wrath.client

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrath.client.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CustomGame

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The entry point and base of the game. Make a class extending this and overriding at least render() method.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Game.Background
      Class to define the background of the game.
      class  Game.EventManager
      Class to manage all event handlers from the wrath.client.events package.
      class  Game.GUI
      Class to define Graphical User Interface (GUI) of the game.
      class  Game.RenderManager 
      class  Game.WindowManager
      Class to manage anything to do with the Game Window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String gameTitle,
            java.lang.String version,
            double ticksPerSecond,
            RenderMode renderMode)
        Constructor. Describes all the essential and unmodifiable variables of the Game.
        Parameters:
        gameTitle - Title of the Game.
        version - Version of the Game.
        ticksPerSecond - The amount of times the logic of the game should update in one second. Recommended 30.
        renderMode - Describes how to game should be rendered (2D or 3D).

    • Method Detail

      • addToTrashCleanup

        public void addToTrashCleanup(Closeable obj)
        Adds a Closeable object to be run after the window closes. Note that the window closing is NOT the end of the program.
        Parameters:
        obj - The Closeable object to run after the window closes.

      • getConfig

        public wrath.util.Config getConfig()
        Gets the Config object of the game.
        Returns:
        Returns the configuration object of the game.

        public wrath.util.Logger getErrorLogger()
        Returns the standard error logger for the application as a whole. Same operation as Logger.getErrorLogger().
        Returns:
        Returns the standard error Logger for the game.

      • getEventManager

        public Game.EventManager getEventManager()
        Gets the Game.EventManager class that manages all event handlers. This class is used to control, access and change Event Handlers from the wrath.client.events package.
        Returns:
        Returns the Game.EventManager class that manages all event handlers.

        public RenderMode getRenderMode()
        Gets whether the game should be rendered in 2D or 3D.
        Returns:
        Returns the enumerator-style representation of the game's rendering mode.

      • getScheduler

        public Scheduler getScheduler()
        Gets the standardized Scheduler for the game.
        Returns:
        Returns the scheduler for the game.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gets the title/name of the Game.
        Returns:
        Returns the title of the Game.

      • getTPS

        public double getTPS()
        Gets the amount of times the game's logic will update in one second. Recommended to not be over 64 or under 10. If the TPS is set over 60 and VSync is on, the ticks will be forced to 60 TPS. Unfortunately, there are not any good ways to overcome said bug, though I am looking into potential solutions.
        Returns:
        Returns the Ticks-per-second of the game's logic.

      • getVersion

        public java.lang.String getVersion()
        Gets the String representation of the Game's Version.
        Returns:
        Returns the version of the game in a String format.

      • getWindowManager

        public Game.WindowManager getWindowManager()
        Gets the Game.WindowManager linked to this Game instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the Game.WindowManager linked to this Game instance.

      • isRunnning

        public boolean isRunnning()
        Returns whether or not the game is currently running.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the game is running, otherwise false.

      • loadJavaPlugin

        public java.lang.Object loadJavaPlugin(java.io.File jarFile)
        Loads a java plugin from the specified file.
        Parameters:
        jarFile - The File to load the plugin from.
        Returns:
        Returns the object formed from the Java plugin.
